com.rohanclan.cfml.dictionary
Class SyntaxDictionary

java.lang.Object
  com.rohanclan.cfml.dictionary.SyntaxDictionary
Direct Known Subclasses:
CFSyntaxDictionary, HTMLSyntaxDictionary, JSSyntaxDictionary
public abstract class SyntaxDictionary
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Rob Base class for dictionaries. The syntax dictionary keeps a name/object map of the tags and functions defined in the dictionary. It provides the methods for gaining access to the dictionary's defined functions & tags, plus access to the attributes that belong to a tag. I think, in future, the acces to the attributes should be done on an per-attribute basis, not gained from the syntax dictionary.

public void loadDictionary(java.lang.String filename)
loads the xml dictionary "filename" into this object. Note: if this dictionary already has tags defined the new items will be added to this dictionary (not replaced)

getFilteredAttributeValues

public java.util.Set getFilteredAttributeValues(java.lang.String tag,
                                                java.lang.String attribute,
                                                java.lang.String start)
Gets the parameter values for a procedure (aka tag or function). Parameter values could be, for example, ColdFusion boolean value options (true/false) for the output attribute for a cffunction. * The set of attribute values is based on the tag being searched for and the attribute required. The values returned will also be filtered by anything contained in the string start.

Parameters:
tag - - name of tag to search for
attribute - - attribute that we're looking for
start - - A partial or full value to filter by
Returns:
set of filtered attribute values

getFilteredAttributes

public java.util.Set getFilteredAttributes(java.lang.String tag,
                                           java.lang.String start)
Gets the attributes for a tag, filtered by start

Parameters:
tag - - tag to search for
start - - attribute text that we wish to filter by
Returns:
The filtered set of Parameters or null if the tag is not found.

limitSet

public static java.util.Set limitSet(java.util.Set st,
                                     java.lang.String start)
limits a set based on a starting string. The set can either be a set of Strings, Tag, Functions, or Parameters

Parameters:
st - the full set
start - the string to use as a limiter
Returns:
everything in the set that starts with start in the format passed in

Returns:

getDictionaryBaseURL

public java.net.URL getDictionaryBaseURL()
Get the base URL for this plug-in. This is used as the offset to load the dictionary file

Returns:

setDictionaryBaseURL

public void setDictionaryBaseURL(java.net.URL dictionaryBaseURL)
Set the base URL for this plug-in. This is used as the offset to load the dictionary file. The default for this setting is dictionary directory in the CFEclipse plugin direcotry

Parameters:
dictionaryBaseURL -
